meanings.definition: A stinging insect with a slender body and narrow waist.
meanings.sent1: The wasps buzzed around the garden.
meanings.sent2: I got stung by a wasp while picking apples.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned chaotic when the wasps decided to join us.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like wasps, stinging with every syllable.
meanings.sent5: The wasps darted through the air like tiny, angry arrows.

meanings.definition: A group of social insects known for their aggressive behavior.
meanings.sent1: The wasps built their nest under the eaves of the house.
meanings.sent2: The children ran away screaming when they saw the wasps swarming.
meanings.sent3: The wasps seemed to be having a heated debate near the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The team of lawyers descended on the case like a swarm of wasps.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of the wasps filled the air with tension and fear.

meanings.definition: A person who is hostile or aggressive.
meanings.sent1: He was a real wasp, always ready for an argument.
meanings.sent2: The boss's sharp tongue earned him a reputation as a wasp in the office.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, he had the attitude of a wasp in a jar.
meanings.sent4: Her wasp-like demeanor kept everyone on edge during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The wasp of a neighbor made living next door quite challenging.
